summary: Use this API to get Product level ads multiple-days daily performance
description: Use this API to get Product level ads multiple-days daily performance.

query.name: performance_date
query.description: This is the parameter to indicate the start date of the time length of performance.

query.name: campaign_id_list
query.description: The campaign ids (comma separated) you want to fetch the performance. (max 100)

request_examples.code:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, array(
  CURLOPT_URL => 'https://partner.uat.shopeemobile.com/api/v2/ads/get_product_campaign_hourly_performance?access_token=access_token&campaign_id_list=11111%2C22222&partner_id=partner_id&performance_date=17-07-2024&shop_id=shop_id&sign=sign&timestamp=timestamp',
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => '',
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 0,
  CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => 'GET',
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array(
    'Content-Type: application/json'
  ),
));

$response = curl_exec($curl);

curl_close($curl);
echo $response;

schema.name: error
schema.description: Error code, empty when no error returned

schema.name: message
schema.description: error description

schema.name: warning
schema.description: If some data cannot respond normally, set the warning

schema.name: request_id
schema.description: request id is unique for each request

schema.name: response
schema.description: response body

schema.name: shop_id
schema.description: Shopee's unique identifier for a shop

schema.name: region
schema.description: The region where this Shop is under

schema.name: campaign_list
schema.description: the list of campaign

schema.name: campaign_id
schema.description: The unique identifier for a campaign

schema.name: ad_type
schema.description: auto, manual

schema.name: campaign_placement
schema.description: search, discovery, all

schema.name: ad_name
schema.description: the name of each campaign

schema.name: metrics_list
schema.description: performance metric list

schema.name: hour
schema.description: This is the parameter to indicate each hour the performance record belongs to.

schema.name: date
schema.description: This is the parameter of the single date on which requestor wants to check the hourly performance

schema.name: impression
schema.description: The number of times shoppers see your ad.

schema.name: clicks
schema.description: The number of times shoppers click on your ad. (Note: Shopee filters out repeated clicks from the same shopper that occur within a short time frame.)

schema.name: ctr
schema.description: The click-through rate (CTR) measures how often shoppers end up clicking on your ad after seeing it. It is the number of clicks on your ad divided by the number of times your ad is seen. CTR = clicks ÷ impressions × 100%.

schema.name: expense
schema.description: The amount spent on your ad.

schema.name: broad_gmv
schema.description: The amount of sales revenue generated from shoppers purchasing products within 7 days of them clicking on your ad.

schema.name: broad_order
schema.description: The number of times shoppers purchased any product from your shop within 7 days of them clicking on your ad.

schema.name: broad_order_amount
schema.description: The total quantity of products purchased by shoppers within 7 days of them clicking on your ad.

schema.name: broad_roi
schema.description: Return on ad spend (ROAS) measures how much revenue is generated by your ad relative to the cost of the ad. It is the amount of sales revenue attributed to your ad divided by the amount spent on the ad. ROAS = GMV ÷ expense. (Note: We recommend monitoring ROAS trends on a weekly basis.)

schema.name: broad_cir
schema.description: The advertising cost of sales (ACOS) measures how much your ad costs relative to the revenue the ad generates. It is the amount spent on your ad divided by the amount of sales revenue attributed to the ad. ACOS = expense ÷ GMV × 100%.

schema.name: cr
schema.description: The conversion rate measures how often shoppers end up purchasing something from your shop after clicking on your ad. It is the number of conversions attributed to your ad divided by the number of clicks on the ad. Conversion rate = conversions ÷ clicks × 100%.

schema.name: cpc
schema.description: The cost per conversion is how much each conversion costs, on average. It is the amount spent on your ad divided by the number of conversions attributed to the ad. Cost per conversion = expense ÷ conversions.

schema.name: direct_order
schema.description: The number of times shoppers purchased the advertised product within 7 days of them clicking on the ad.

schema.name: direct_order_amount
schema.description: The total quantity of the advertised product purchased by shoppers within 7 days of them clicking on the ad.

schema.name: direct_gmv
schema.description: The amount of sales revenue generated from shoppers purchasing the advertised product within 7 days of them clicking on the ad.

schema.name: direct_roi
schema.description: The direct return on ad spend, or direct ROAS, measures how much revenue is generated from sales of the advertised product, relative to the cost of the ad. It is the amount of sales revenue for the advertised product attributed to the ad, divided by the amount spent on the ad. Direct ROAS = direct GMV ÷ expense.

schema.name: direct_cir
schema.description: The direct advertising cost of sales, or direct ACOS, measures how much your ad costs relative to the revenue generated from sales of the advertised product. It is the amount spent on the ad divided by the amount of sales revenue for the advertised product that is attributed to the ad. Direct ACOS = expense ÷ direct GMV × 100%.

schema.name: direct_cr
schema.description: The direct conversion rate measures how often shoppers end up purchasing the advertised product after clicking on the ad. Direct conversion rate is the number of direct conversions divided by the number of clicks. Direct conversion rate = direct conversions ÷ clicks × 100%.

schema.name: cpdc
schema.description: The cost per direct conversion is how much each direct conversion costs, on average. It is the amount spent on your ad divided by the number of direct conversions attributed to the ad. Cost per direct conversion = expense ÷ direct conversions.

error_codes.message: Invalid campaign ID for this shop.
The information you queried is not found.
Only the supported HTTP method for the API is allowed.
The date must be today or earlier than today up to 6 months ago.
Too many requests, please reduce the request rate and try again later.
Too many requests for the shop at the moment, please try again later.
Too many requests at the moment, please try again later.
